intro: Shawia paucidentata, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and pink. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Shawia paucidentata is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
